citeinfo.title: Global Gridded Sea Surface Temperature and Sea Ice Concentration Boundary Conditions at 1 by 1 Degree Resolution for CMIP5, 1870-2012

descript.abstract: This data set provides sea surface temperature (SST) and sea ice concentration (i.e., percentage of area covered by sea ice) boundary conditions for model intercomparison projects (e.g., CMIP5 and AMIP2). It is based on the merged data product of observed monthly mean SST) and sea ice concentration from 1870 to 2012 at 1x1 degree resolution described by Hurrell et al., 2008). The boundary condition data sets are described by Taylor et al. (2000). SST and sea ice concentration boundary conditions are specified such that the monthly means computed from the model output precisely agree with the observations. The boundary conditions can be obtained in one of two ways: (1) complete a short form requesting that the Program for Climate Model Diagnosis and Intercomparison (PCMDI) at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory prepare the boundary condition data sets specifically for the grid used by the userâ€™s model or (2) obtain the boundary condition data sets at the highest resolution available (1x1 degree), and then interpolate to the modelâ€™s grid. The data are available in several formats: ASCII files; NetCDF files; and GRIB files. Cautions about using the second approach are explained at [http://www-pcmdi.llnl.gov/projects/amip/AMIP2EXPDSN/BCS/amip2bcs.php]. References: Hurrell, J.W., J.J. Hack, D. Shea, J.M. Caron, and J. Rosinski. 2008. A New Sea Surface Temperature and Sea Ice Boundary Dataset for the Community Atmosphere Model. J. Climate 21: 5145â€“5153. Taylor, K.E., D. Williamson, and F. Zwiers. 2000. The sea surface temperature and sea-ice concentration boundary conditions for AMIP II simulations, PCMDI Report No. 60, Program for Climate Model Diagnosis and Intercomparison, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, Livermore, California, 25 pp.

cntperp.cntorg: Program for Climate Model Diagnosis and Intercomparison (PCMDI), Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, Livermore, California, USA.

distinfo.resdesc: Global Gridded Sea Surface Temperature and Sea Ice Concentration Boundary Conditions at 1 by 1 Degree Resolution for CMIP5, 1870-2012. 2008. Available on-line at [http://www-pcmdi.llnl.gov/projects/amip/AMIP2EXPDSN/BCS/amip2bcs.php] from the Program for Climate Model Diagnosis and Intercomparison (PCMDI), Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, Livermore, California, USA.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

Data_Set_Link.Label: Request for Model-Specific Sea Surface Temperature and Sea Ice Concentration Boundary Conditions
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: This form should be used by modelers to request that PCMDI prepare the boundary condition data sets specifically for the grid used by their model. On the form modelers are asked to provide some essential information concerning their model grid. Modelers may also request that PCMDI create an optimal land/sea mask for their grid. Otherwise, modelers should provide PCMDI with their own land/sea mask, which is needed for proper interpolation. A link to step-by-step procedure for obtaining and applying the AMIP II boundary conditions is provided in the Documentation section below.

Data_Set_Link.Label: AMIP II Sea Surface Temperature and Sea Ice Concentration Boundary Condition Data at a 1 by 1 Degree Resolution, 1870-2012
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: Download boundary conditions here. The data are available in several formats: ASCII files; NetCDF files; and GRIB files. See cautionary notes at this web page as well as at [http://www-pcmdi.llnl.gov/projects/amip/AMIP2EXPDSN/BCS/amip2bcs.php].
